website_summaries.verdict: A tough sole and insulation for colder conditions.
pros: Warm, comfortable winter boot with great arch support and a high collar
Stylish and practical, these will keep you warm even on icy terrain
cons: Size runs small, stitching may separate after extensive wear

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, very warm!
customer_reviews.text: After reading that these boots run small I ordered one size up and hit the jackpot. I wear size 8 in most keen shoes so ordered size 9 and they fit perfect. Well made, sturdy, nice tread that grips well on ice and snow, and warm! My only complaint is that the pull-up-loop on the back is too small to get your finger through. Why?!!! Otherwise I love these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Pete S.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful boot
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get this boot, however, my size was not available in women's. I read the reviews, and most folks said that you needed to order 1/2 size larger at least. I wear a size 10 in women's, and normally I would order a size 8 in men's. I went ahead and ordered a size 8 1/2 in men's. They fit perfectly. I do not like wearing thick socks, and the padding in these boots is wonderful. I put on a pair of my athletic socks with these ,and the feel and fit is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: It's a good thing I did
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 9 in women's shoes. When I bought the Keen Targhee Mid hikers, I ordered a 9.5 because it was suggested they run small. Since I couldn't find my size in the women's version of the Durand Polar boot, I went with the men's version, and ordered up a full size. It's a good thing I did! These absolutely run small based on the insulation inside the boot. A half size won't do it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: If you need to use a heavy sock you better get at least one size larger
customer_reviews.text: These boots run small. If you need to use a heavy sock you better get at least one size larger,..maybe more. Otherwise they are a very good boot. I ordered 1/2 size larger than I normally wear and then had to exchange them for a full size larger. But a very comfortable boot that is light and keeps you warm.
customer_reviews.author: coolreed

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, but ORDER A FULL SIZE LARGER THAN ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, but ORDER A FULL SIZE LARGER THAN USUAL. I own other Keen boots but these were so tight in that size that I actually could not get them on. Fortunately, I have a friend they fit perfectly and who loves them. I reordered a size larger, wear them all the time when outside. The past month the temps here in North Dakota have been consistently fairly cold... ten above to minus 40, and my feet, which tend to get cold, haven't! Boots are also very comfortable and have a foot box much larger than typical European design. Glad to see they're made in Oregon.
customer_reviews.author: R. Blatherwick

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Really good boots. I ordered 1 size larger than normal and they fit great. My normal width is a D. These boots are a bit tight thu the width but I'm hoping for stretch. I would order the E width next time. The boots are waterproof and warm. I am pleased with the overall comfort as well. No real breakin time required. Very good quality boot. I will buy again. Thanks Keen and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: The Summit Country boots fit better and last forever.  Recommend those.
customer_reviews.text: I own several pairs of Keen boots. I highly recommend them. These Polar Durand have the correct length, but a little tight on top at the toes that will probably stretch out though. Update. Still tight, no stretching, maybe order 1/2 size larger. Also there is a rubber bump under the sole insert inside at the heel. After wearing a couple of weeks, it feels like there is a rock under my heel, can't wear them. Can't return them, Going to see about cutting it out. It's not a defect, it's an oval piece of rubber, and the insert has a small indentation where the oval fits, part of the design, but very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: rod

customer_reviews.title: I really like the boot so far and it feels like I ...
customer_reviews.text: Boot definitely needs to be purchased 1/2 size larger than your regular. I appreciate when previous reviewers give me the heads up and they were right on for this one. That being said, I really like the boot so far and it feels like I expect a Keen product to feel and fit. I have recently been buying Keen replacements as I wear other things out and I have liked the results so far. I picked this boot over other Keens as it is assembled in the USA (Portland, OR) and it had almost entirely metal lacing points as opposed to the little webbing strap eyelets. I am leery of those.
customer_reviews.author: Sisyphus

customer_reviews.title: These boots are like wearing slippers
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for! These boots are like wearing slippers. Keep my feet warm in sub zero temps. 100% waterproof. Not bulky so you can wear them with a nice pair of jeans on a night out and no one knows your wearing snow boots. Light on the feet, flexible, over all great boot.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and comfort as you would expect from Keen
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and comfort as you would expect from Keen. Heed suggestions to go up a half size. I found this to be true. The toe box is slightly narrower than other Keen's. The only thing preventing this product from a five star is the lack of loop for gaiters. For a winter hiking boot, that omission seems odd.
customer_reviews.author: Mooks

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 Keen boot when to the Keen site they recommended to order a .5 size larger in this boot and glad I did a little tight but after I wore them just one day the loosened up and fit great. Also very warm my feet have never been warmer in the cold Wis weather.
customer_reviews.author: James A Murphy

customer_reviews.title: ... these boots run a bit small so I was fortunate to have ordered them a size larger than normal
customer_reviews.text: Agree with the other reviews that these boots run a bit small so I was fortunate to have ordered them a size larger than normal. Have worn a few times out in the snow and they keep my feet warm and dry. No hard break-in period like you have with leather boots, so they were literally out of the box, on my feet and I put them to work. Comfortable all the way! Great boots and would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Warm, I live close to copper harbor Michigan. Very cold with large amounts of snow. These boots keep my feet warm & dry while I'm outside with my big snowblower, shooting the snow at my neighbors yard!!
customer_reviews.author: Blair Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great for snowshoeing
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great. They fit as expected...I'm a size 10 1/2 and bought size 11 anticipating thicker socks. They're the warmest boots I've ever owned. I've been using them for snowshoeing and they are comfortable and warm the entire day.
customer_reviews.author: Yolo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Returned the product due to fit and time needed. Excellent quality, comfortable, insulation caused them to be tighter than normal Keen sizing I wear at the ball of the foot. Would suggest trying half size larger for many. If you are looking for the very wide foot and toe area of Keen this seems to ve a tighter last.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Very poor workmanship and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Initially rated these boots very high but they fell apart after wearing them maybe 6 times. Returning defective boots is impossible after 30 days on Amazon. See photos.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Best Winter Boots I Have Ever Owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! Light and warm! Best winter boots I have ever owned! I went to REI to find my size, I normally wear a 9, but a 10 in these fits me perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable For Snow Hiking
customer_reviews.text: Wore these this winter. Very comfortable and quite warm for winter snow hiking. Can't comment on the durability yet, but they weathered this winter very well.
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with these boots. Hiking in Yellowstone has been great. Warm dry feet with great protection.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Burford

customer_reviews.title: New Lighter Snow Boot
customer_reviews.text: What is nice about this Keen Boot is that it fits like a lighter hiking boot, than heavy flat soul boot. Weather in Midwest is in the 50's, so no chance yet to test that it is waterproof, but after six pairs of shoes, I'm not wooried.
customer_reviews.author: David F.Ewart

customer_reviews.title: Typical Keen Quality with too short of a height for a snow boot
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots that I thought were just too short for a heavy winter, Of course this winter was a little atypical, but they were about 2" shorter than the LL Bean Snow boots I ended up settling on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Keens
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 types of Keens shoes and the 8" support these give is great. I have worn them for 2 days straight so far and they need no break-in time. I really like the support they provide for my ankles. Some reviews talked about the stitching being bad but mine have no issues and the soles are glued on with out flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: These RUN SMALL buy a full size over regular non KEEN SIZE for heavy socks. Great winter boots!
customer_reviews.text: The Size Issue: 2 of us in the shop wear Keen boots. Both of us bought Durand Polar Winter Boots ONE (1) FULL size over our "regular size". A regular Size 9 (in any shoe other than Keen) bought a 10. I am size 11 (in anything other than Keen) bought a 12. Both FIT perfect for heavy socks. Put these on and walked a few mileS on the job. Classic Keen athletic shoe light, comfy and very warm with minimal break in.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who work outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I live in harsh winter elements and I work outside. These keep my feet warm and protected. They are definitely worth the cost and have held up perfectly so far. If I have any issues I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: initially I really like them, feel comfortable and very solid
customer_reviews.text: I only tried them on and they were a bit tighter than expected, returning for a half size up. However, initially I really like them, feel comfortable and very solid. I will update this review if needed, otherwise I will stick with the 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: weld made good Quality, I did return it
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, but my toes was not warm enough , cold, weld made good Quality , I did return it . still looking ,need more insulation in boots
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Send it. Back. /. Not sure. If. I. Ever got my money back
customer_reviews.author: ruben

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and a great boot. Perfect for being active in the cold. Also a good boot for snowshoeing.
customer_reviews.author: A. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great winter hiking boots with typical Keen comfort
customer_reviews.text: Great winter hiking boots with typical Keen comfort, style and utility. Hiked 6 miles the first day with no problems at all. Have a pair of Keen 3 season boots that I love, so I stayed with the same brand as did my woman hiking friend and she lives hers too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Liked the boots but the toe box was too small ...
customer_reviews.text: Liked the boots but the toe box was too small and I had to return them. My son swears by these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dan H

customer_reviews.title: I love these boots. Another great boot by Keen.
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel. Warm and comfy. Read the reviews fortunately, and bought a half size larger than usual just to accommodate a mid weight tube sock. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: CMurph

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and dry.
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. Feel broken in right out of the box. Wore them only 3 days before winter camping trip in MI. Hiked/snowshoed 10 plus miles in wet snow, slush and mud. Feet were bone dry and comfortable. Second pair of Keens. They are my new "go to" brand. Would be 5 stars but for running a little small. Go a full size larger than normal shoe size if layering a silk and heavy wool sock.
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: Best feeling boot
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes. They fit well, required zero break in time, and kept my feet warm. Mine were made in the USA, so that's a plus. I will definitely buy Keen again.
customer_reviews.author: JGos

customer_reviews.title: Not too heavy does well on ice
customer_reviews.text: This larger size boot fits perfectly Very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.author: yellow lab lover

customer_reviews.title: comfortable boot that provides good support and is warm
customer_reviews.text: Everything you expect from Keen. A solid, comfortable boot that provides good support and is warm. These are great for hiking - tall enough to keep the muck out but allow freedom of movement.
customer_reviews.author: Gnomey

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful boots!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband and he is in love with them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Okendo

customer_reviews.title: One season so far good but they fit small I did order 1 size ...
customer_reviews.text: One season so far good but they fit small I did order 1 size larger and still tight but they are so warm I only need 1 sock...on each foot of course
customer_reviews.author: Greg Tynkaluk

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. It’s 5 degrees F outside with snow and ice. My feet stay warm and dry. They feel very light compared to my other winter boots and they look cool.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfect. Feet are ALWAYS toasty warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: Got them a half size larger per reviews. They fit perfect. Feet are ALWAYS toasty warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and extremely comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and extremely comfortable right out of the box. Based on timing of the purchase, at this point, I won't need to wear them until next year. So, we'll see how they hold up next winter.
customer_reviews.author: EDino1

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Haven't had a chance to break them in just yet but the fit and construction are top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great boot - runs small so consider getting 1/2 size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Great arch support. Keeps your feet dry and warm. I found this boot runs slightly small. I typically wear an 11, but got an 11.5 on reading other reviews. The reviews I read were correct, this boot runs slightly small. Glad I got them a half-size larger than I normally do.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots, well made, great wear and comfort, keep your feet warm
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Run Small but Very Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of wide feet and each of us has at least one pair of Keens whether it's hiking boots or snow boots. True to Keen's word, these are extremely comfortable boots. I bought these for my son who is VERY difficult to please when it comes to shoe-wear. Often when we buy him shoes/boots/sneakers/sandals, we end up having to return and find him something else. However, not with the Keen brand. Now that his foot growth has slowed down a little, we don't mind paying extra. We did have to exchange these for a full size up, a slight inconvenience but Amazon makes it easy to return/exchange with free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: marla

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love them! The laces were cheap we had to replace them
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot, in snow most of the day showed ...
customer_reviews.text: make sure you order a half size bigger. Awesome boot, in snow most of the day showed a little dampness. Stayed warm.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Martinson

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, shame they are hard to find and buy.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Smaller fit than other Keen shoes
customer_reviews.text: Should have ordered a half or even a full size larger than I normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot but
customer_reviews.text: Nice boot but a little too small. Too bad they don't come in half sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: The main thing I like about them is they are really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I will be using them for upland bird hunting in cold weather, they are warm and dry. The main thing I like about them is they are really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered half size up and it was fine. Much lighter than expected with great grip in ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered half size up and it was fine. Much lighter than expected with great grip in the snow. My feet stayed toasty and warm all day during a disc golf tournament in NH during a day that started out -6 below.
customer_reviews.author: James MacRae

customer_reviews.title: Definitely go .5-1 size bigger than your normal size
customer_reviews.text: So far so good Kept my feet warm and dry depending on the brand I wear a 9.5 to 10 and I purchased 10.5 fit great would not have hurt to get an 11 to fit thick socks loosely
customer_reviews.author: Moreye

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are the best winter boots I have ever had! Very warm, but not bulky. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR LANDSCAPERS!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable right out of the box, and warm so far!
customer_reviews.author: M. Leone

customer_reviews.title: I have 4 pair keen shoes in a 10 and they fit great. I ordered 10 1/2 so I could wear ...
customer_reviews.text: they run small. I have 4 pair keen shoes in a 10 and they fit great. I ordered 10 1/2 so I could wear a pair of wool socks. I should of ordered an 11.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great feel.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable out of the box. Order 1/2 size larger and you won't be disappointed. High quality.
customer_reviews.author: David Nalley

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots, Very Warm, Be careful of Size if you have wide feet or Muscular Calfs.
customer_reviews.text: They fit a bit snug , but they certainly are warm. Large and /or muscular calfs don’t have much room if you need to lace these all the way up. Be careful if you have wide feet. However, all in all they are very good boots.
customer_reviews.author: Schr0

customer_reviews.title: narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10.5 and ordered size 11. I had to return the boot because it was to narrow for my foot. Otherwise it looked like a nice boot.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nieman

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze  fit
customer_reviews.text: I take an 11 in other keen work shoes but these are way too small
customer_reviews.author: Jim NJ

customer_reviews.title: These are great boots!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Much less bulky than Sorels or other winter boots. Warm comfortable and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbabwe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for those who have narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for those who have narrow feet, one of the best investments for someone who has to work outside in snow and rain all night!!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great looking boot and warm enough for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boot and warm enough for my needs ,but runs small. I normally wear a size 10, ordered an 11 and fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: These are great boots. Probably not suitable for extreme conditions
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. Probably not suitable for extreme conditions, particularly deep cold below 0F, but for everyday wear in a winter city, they're outstanding. Very comfortable. Great combo of comfort and protection. Like winter-proof hikers. I wore mine every day through this past Alaska winter and loved them. Replaced North Face boots (which fell apart at the rubber/leather seam) and will buy these again when it's time. Great boots.
customer_reviews.author: Keith N. Popely

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item fit as expected and was very comfortable, seems like a great boot for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs small size
customer_reviews.text: I read the previous reviews and added a half size to my initial order, but had to return my initial boots for another size larger.
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoWalleyeAngler

customer_reviews.title: toasty and dry
customer_reviews.text: These are impressive boots. Like most KEENS the footbed is very present, giving your foot and arch a snug fit. I don't think these are suitable for long distances, but ideal for slogging through mud and ankle-deep slush. These are warm and waterproof, and I am pretty impressed. I hope they break in a bit and give me a bit more "give" for walking, but these are winter boots...not hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Jessamin Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Haven't worn them yet, waiting for snow but love the fit, not as narrow as other brands. Fit great and exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: Ultra comfy. Just order half a size up.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 0.5 size bigger than i would, and they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Mr H.

customer_reviews.title: ... 1 size small other than that very light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Seems about 1/2 to 1 size small other than that very light and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Jordy kirk

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot.
customer_reviews.text: Nice boot... wish I would of went for the 600g boot my feet get cold once in awhile and the boot is slippery on snow and ice
customer_reviews.author: James Barker

customer_reviews.title: only problem I have shoes hurts the bridge off my ...
customer_reviews.text: only problem I have shoes hurts the bridge off my feet. very uncomfortable. don't know if there is a break in period. really tight with normal sock. Maybe I should of ordered at size 10 due to the insulation, thx for asking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I was going back and forth on which Keen winter boot to, this one or the Summit. They're very few reviews on the Durant, mostly from people who were waiting for it to snow before really trying them out. Just for regular wear, I like them. Comfortable and sturdy. I haven't tried driving with them, the have a thicker soul than what I'm use to and a little wider. For general wear though, they're great. Will see when winter hits
customer_reviews.author: Andy Karlok

customer_reviews.title: Already Broke in
customer_reviews.text: Wore them for the first time today to walk the dog, just to break them in. Felt like I had been walking in them for months. Light weight and super comfortable. Bought them for an Antarctic expedition with National Geographic in November. I'll write another review when I get back.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Cary

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: They are great boots but my left boot was much tighter than the right....
customer_reviews.author: janine butler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these boots are really nice love it it fit as i expected
customer_reviews.author: guillermo mejia

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: You have to go up a 1/2 size. I wear a 9.5 and ordered a 10. Fit perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best boots I've ever owned. Love them. So comfortable and warm. They look great too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... boots 17-20 degree weather and they keep my feed nice and toasty
customer_reviews.text: Wore these boots 17-20 degree weather and they kept the top of my feet warm. I WOULD recommend getting a size bigger as these run a little smaller than what I'm used to. My wife bought the same pair and hers are small as well. I'm a little disappointed as other 10.5 boots from Keen fit perfectly. I have to keep them loose to make sure they don't make my outer foot go numb. I also have keen hiking boots and always been a big fan of Keen. I find Keen boots to be durable, comfortable and worth the money. I have a pair of hiking boots I’ve beat the crap out doing yard work. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful boots but way too narrow and small for my husband!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Movesian

customer_reviews.title: Normally wear a 10 in all my boots, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Normally wear a 10 in all my boots, but they were to small, reordered a 10 1/2 and they fit fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: I probably could wear them all day if it were cold enough. Great boots.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Best winter boots, ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best winter boots, ever! They eat laces, at least for me, so plan to replace your laces every year, but other than that these are the best boots I've ever worn. Fit true to measured foot size for me. My feet have never gotten wet when wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing hiking /snow boot. Tennis shoe comfortable and very warm in extreme weather.
customer_reviews.author: standalone

customer_reviews.title: Order a full size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Even ordering a half size bigger, they are a tad snug. I just won't be able to wear thick wool socks is all.
customer_reviews.author: CJARCH

customer_reviews.title: This Keen boot is a great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the most comfortable boots I've ever worn. And, I have problems with my feet (pinched nerves)! I do recommend to get one size bigger, especially if you're going to wear thick socks. Warm, dry and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Lansing, MI

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable boot. Warm and water proof. The size seems to accurate
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A little tight in the toes compared to other Keen boots.
customer_reviews.author: PBSki

customer_reviews.title: These were pretty good, but the sole kind of hurt my ...
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty good, but the sole kind of hurt my foot. I only tried them on temporarily before returning them because I didnt end up needing them. But I think it is possible that with a little bit of wearing in they would have been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dr SpaceMan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Assumed that going up 1/2 a size would allow for a heavier sock.
customer_reviews.author: jim greene

customer_reviews.title: The boot fit perfect and seemed like it would be a great winter ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm torn about this review. The boot fit perfect and seemed like it would be a great winter boot. However, one of the lacing eyelets was broken so I had to return the item and there were no more in my size.
customer_reviews.author: Explore

customer_reviews.title: Love the boot...BUT!
customer_reviews.text: Love the boot, BUT! Ordered in my size and too small. Returned and order half size larger and STILL TOO SMALL. And now they are out of one more size larger! A real bummer as these are real nice boots!
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves these boots for the cold Minnesota winters! ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves these boots for the cold Minnesota winters! They are a bit difficult and time consuming to get on, but I think all winter boots would be that way.
customer_reviews.author: RKRushingTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Havnt really put em to the test yet but there very comfortable the 13 fit a little big as expected so i can layer socks if needed after winter hits ill update my review
customer_reviews.author: Brx123

customer_reviews.title: Can't give it 5 stars since I don't really know yet
customer_reviews.text: Haven't worn them outside yet. TOO SMALL ALTHOUGH WE ORDERD THE BOOTS A SIZE LARGER.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: These things are amazingly warm and comfortable. I cannot wait for winter now
customer_reviews.text: These do run a bit small. I ordered one size up, and they fit perfectly with socks. These things are amazingly warm and comfortable. I cannot wait for winter now.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a broken lace hook. Had to return. Too bad, they seemed nice. And, yes, order half a size larger.
customer_reviews.author: RJHarlan

customer_reviews.title: Incredible boots!
customer_reviews.text: Bought half size up, because customers reported they run small. That 1/2 size was perfect adjustment! Comfortable and lightweight. Perfect in snow! Rated highest for cold weather and wet snow conditions!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! I put 5 miles on them today in the snow - most comfortable winter boots I've ever had!
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Great boot. If you wear thick socks get one ...
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. If you wear thick socks get one size larger. Thin socks half size up. Boots are lite and look and feel well built. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good so far I have worn them maybe 4 times put them on tonight Ilet pop out love the boots but how can I fix them thanks
customer_reviews.author: seth

product_meta.title: KEEN Durand Polar Waterproof Boot - Men's
product_meta.description: FEATURES of the Keen Men's Durand Polar Waterproof Boot Leather and synthetic upper 400 gram Keen.Warm insulation Keen.Dry waterproof, breathable membrane Integrated PU heel cushion Removable thermal heat shield footbed TPU stability shank Direct attach PU midsole for long-lasting comfort Dual compound snow and ice grip rubber outsole
feature_bullets: Made in the USA or Imported
STAY WARM: The Durand Polar boots feature KEEN's lightweight charcoal bamboo insulation and a thermal heat-shield footbed that'll keep your feet warm up to -40F/-40C
STAY DRY: KEEN's waterproof, breathable membrane keeps your feet dry, making these boots ideal for outdoor activities in the snow and slush
COMFORTABLE: These boots feature a PU (polyurethane) foam midsole for resilient cushioning and a removable, metatomical PU footbed for extra support and ease of cleaning
BREATHABLE: The mesh lining lets your feet breathe throughout the day so they can stay healthy and dry
AMERICAN BUILT: The Durand Polar is assembled in Portland, Oregon, using the finest materials from around the world
